=== START BH04697 ===

TABLET OF NARJES

In the Name of God, the One!

Praise be to the All-Powerful, All-Wise Lord Who distinguished man from other created things through the jewel of utterance. Through the union of creation, infinite manifestations appeared and countless arts and knowledge came into being from non-existence. Exalted be His wisdom, and glorified be His power, might, grandeur and sovereignty!

O my handmaiden, O my leaf! The glance of favor has been directed to you from the Prison. All the servants and handmaidens of the world were adorned with the ornament of existence from nothingness for the recognition of this Day, yet all remain heedless and veiled from the fruit of existence, save whom God willeth. Through divine grace you have attained eternal life and been confirmed in the recognition of the Great Announcement and the Straight Path.

Glorify your Lord, then praise Him and say: Praise be to Thee, O my God, for having illumined my heart with the light of Thy knowledge and enabled me to turn toward Thee. O Lord! I testify to Thy oneness and singleness, and that Thou art God, there is no God but Thee, the Single, the One, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. O Lord! I beseech Thee by the penetrating power of Thy utterance and the manifestation of Thy grandeur amongst Thy servants to make my will annihilated in Thy will and my desire in Thy desire. O Lord! Verily, Thy handmaiden and the daughter of Thy handmaiden has placed her trust in Thee and committed her affairs unto Thee. Ordain for me from the ocean of Thy bounty and the heaven of Thy generosity that which will make me content with Thy good-pleasure. Verily, Thou art the Mighty, the Glorious, the All-Bountiful.

=== END BH04697 ===

=== START BH04699 ===

O Abu’l-Qasim, upon thee be the Glory of God! In My Name, the Manifest, the Speaking before all faces! Praise be to the Ancient Beauty Who hath illumined the worlds of remembrance and utterance with the lights of His Most Great Name, and through His Most Exalted Word hath guided the people of the realm of creation to the supreme horizon. Glorified be His grace that hath encompassed all who are in the heavens and on earth, and exalted be His mercy that hath preceded existence itself, from the first to the last. O Abu’l-Qasim! Thy mention hath been heard, and the Lord of all being, with supreme benevolence, hath remembered thee in this Most Holy, Most Exalted Tablet. This is a day wherein the veils have been rent asunder and the All-Bountiful hath come with manifest sovereignty. Look not upon the people and their veils, for their vain desires have withheld them - verily they are in grievous error. They have cast guidance behind their backs - verily they are among the most lost in the Book of God, the Lord of all worlds. Beware lest the doubts of the people hold thee back from My Self-Subsisting Name, or the might of the oppressors frighten thee. When thou hast attained unto My remembrance and drunk the choice wine of utterance from the hand of My bounty, turn thy face toward God and say: “Praise be unto Thee, O Lord of all humanity, and thanksgiving be unto Thee, O Sovereign of the kingdom of names, for having made known unto me the Dawning-Place of Thy Revelation and the Dayspring of Thy signs. I beseech Thee by this Promised One, through Whom Thou hast fulfilled Thy promise, manifested Thy sovereignty, and revealed that which lay hidden in Thy knowledge, to aid me to serve Thy Cause and to arise in service to Thy loved ones. Verily, Thou art powerful to do as Thou willest through Thy mighty and wondrous Word.”

=== END BH04699 ===

=== START BH04700 ===

O Sadiq, upon him be the Glory of God! In the name of Him Who is sovereign over all names. Praise befitteth the Lord of Bounty and the Sovereign of existence Who, through a single word, illumined the world with the light of His manifestation and adorned the ears of mankind with the hearing of “The All-Merciful hath come.” Blessed is the soul that hath attained and found its way to the court of His throne. O thou who art mentioned before the Wronged One! A single word from among the words which, on the first day of the Manifestation, streamed forth from the tongue of grandeur and descended from the supreme horizon of the heart, is the protector, preserver, helper and succorer of all - and that word is the blessed word “He doeth whatsoever He willeth.” And the reason for its revelation is that every seeker might, through this exalted word, guard himself from idle fancies and vain imaginings and recognize God as the One with authority. Some, despite acknowledging this word, uttered that which caused grief to the Concourse on High. Say: O servants! Have mercy upon yourselves. Reflect upon that which hath appeared and turn ye unto the evidences. The fruit of the blessed Tree hath ever been and shall ever be its signs. Blessed are they that attain thereunto. O My loved ones! Guide ye the people to the straight path of God through wisdom and utterance. However, what is essential and of first importance is to purify one’s existence with the Kawthar of counsels from corruption, conflict, rancor and hatred. Thus hath God spoken, thus hath He commanded, and thus hath He decreed. Blessed are they that act, blessed are they that are fair-minded, and blessed are they that are steadfast.

=== END BH04700 ===

=== START BH04701 ===

He is God, exalted be His glory, the Most Great, the All-Powerful

Praise that is sanctified above comprehension and minds befitteth the Lord of the worlds Who, through the Most Great Name, hath cast down the banner of associating partners with God and raised high the standard of divine unity in the most exalted station, and through the appearance of His Beloved One hath adorned the world with a new adorning. Upon Him be His peace and blessings and mercy, and upon His family and companions through whom the light of faith shone forth and illumined the horizons.

The one bearing the Name of Bounty, upon him be the peace of God, was present and mentioned thy letter before the Wronged One. We beseech God to strengthen thee and assist thee and ordain for thee that which shall endure as long as His names endure. In that letter mention was made of teaching them. In this matter wisdom is required. Drink thou the sealed wine in the name of the Self-Subsisting in the innermost mystery. Well is it with thee and pleasant it is to thee. In all circumstances We counsel you to wisdom. “Concealment is better than revelation.” The people were not and are not worthy. Not every soul was or is worthy of this most pure Kawthar. The days of attainment to Our presence are remembered and remembered art thou. We beseech God that He may assist thee to hold fast unto the wisdom that hath been sent down. Convey Our greetings to the kindred and illumine them with the light of remembrance. Verily He is with you wherever ye may be. Verily He is the protector of those who do good.

=== END BH04701 ===

=== START BH04702 ===

His honor Aqa Mirza Asadu’llah, upon him be the Glory of God

In Rabi’u’l-Avval 1301

In the Name of our Lord, the Most Holy, the Most Great, the Most Exalted, the Most Glorious

Praise, sanctified above all words, befitteth the Lord of all mankind Who was not deterred by the tribulations of the world and the clamor of the nations from His holy purpose. The ranks of the polytheists, the multitudes of the deniers, the might of the people of tyranny and error, and the tumult of the ignorant could not prevent His penetrating Will. At a time when the arrows of tribulations and afflictions were raining down like showers, He summoned all with the tongue of grandeur to the highest horizon. The clouds and mists, the rain and trees and fruits, all bear witness that the Supreme Pen was never still in any state. If at times it appeared outwardly to pause, inwardly it was engaged in spiritual motion, revealing to the world of being whatsoever was meet and seemly. Glorified be His greatness and His power!

Some of the ignorant ones of the earth have desired to prevent the effulgence of the lights of the Sun of Truth, to extinguish the divine light with the breaths of doubt and fancy, and to quench the fire of the Divine Lote-Tree. By the life of our Beloved and your Beloved! This station is the station of “far be it, far be it!” Until the Day of Resurrection, man will repeatedly ask: What profit did Nimrod gain, and what benefit did Pharaoh reap? Have they not heard the tale of Abu Sufyan, or learned of the oppression of Caiaphas who was the Jewish judge, and likewise of Pilate who was the governor of that place? Which oppressor ever benefited from his deeds or gained any profit? They have lost indeed who denied the right of God, broke His Covenant, turned away from Him, and pronounced judgment against the Manifestations of His Cause with manifest tyranny.

I beseech Thee, O my God, by the light of Thy countenance and the radiance of Thy presence, by the fragrance of Thy robe in Thy days, and by the breath of Thy revelation and the signs of Thy power, to send down upon Thy loved ones that which will protect them from the tyranny of Thy creatures, and upon Thy enemies that which will prevent them from what they have purposed in their rebellion against Thee and their transgression against Thy Cause. Though I know with certainty that all profit belongeth to the people of Thy love, and all loss to those who have turned away from Thee and opposed Thee, yet I beseech Thee by Thy generosity and bounty to hasten the days which Thou hast ordained for the exaltation of Thy Cause, the manifestation of Thy Word, and the spread of Thy verses. Verily Thou art the Almighty, the Powerful, the All-Conquering, the Omnipotent.

O thou beloved of my heart! The servant hath been gladdened by that which flowed from thy pen concerning what hath befallen your honor and the friends of God in the land of Ta. Although thy letter brought grief to all the world, since it described the tribulations of them that are detached and sincere, yet being adorned with the mention of the Best-Beloved of the worlds, it gave unto silence the power of utterance. A hundred thousand joys be sacrificed for such grief as is borne in the path of God, and a hundred thousand blessings circle round such hunger as is endured in prison for His sake. Chains in prison are more precious than the crowns of kings, and the world’s cruelties more dear than life itself when suffered in His path. The servant beseecheth his Lord to aid His loved ones and chosen ones to arise to serve Him and teach His Cause, let nothing whatsoever hinder them. The Truth beareth witness that the eyes of this servant were gladdened by those souls who in these days have diffused the sweet savors of steadfastness. They are the kings of the realms of certitude, tranquility, steadfastness and faithfulness. The opposition of the opposers, the denial of the deniers, and the might of the oppressors are even as the buzzing of a fly - it hath neither permanence nor duration. After reading and becoming apprised thereof, he directed himself to the most exalted Summit and the highest Station, and presented a detailed account before His presence. This is what the Tongue of the Intended One hath spoken, these are His - exalted be His glory - words:

He is the All-Knowing, the All-Seeing […]

O thou who journeyest in the lands! Hearken unto the call of the Wronged One amongst the servants. He hath come with the truth and summoned all creation unto a station before which every lofty station hath bowed down, and hath revealed that at whose revelation every trustworthy scholar hath prostrated. We opened unto their faces the gates of goodly things, yet they rose up to harm Us in such wise as caused the Concourse on High and the dwellers of this exalted station to lament. Heedlessness hath so encompassed the slaves of passion that they have arisen with utmost tyranny and rebellion to extinguish the light of the Day-Star of knowledge. Woe and misery unto them! From every direction the fire of oppression blazeth and the smoke of tyranny is manifest. However, God shall extinguish the former and dispel the latter. The world hath found no rest from the deeds of the oppressors and tyrants.

O thou who drinkest the wine of My love! The oppressor sinketh into the earth each day like unto Korah, yet perceiveth it not. That which the All-Informed hath revealed shall soon be made manifest, despite every stubborn tyrant. Leave them to themselves, and their possessions, and their words, and their deeds, holding fast unto the cord of teaching. Thus doth command thee the Strong, the Powerful.

Convey My greetings to the friends. Say: God willing, arise to promote the Cause of God with utmost strength, might and power, in such wise that the fragrance of steadfastness may envelope the world. He is the Helper, He is the Almighty. Power and might have been expounded in all the Tablets. All must conquer the world through the hosts of virtuous deeds and goodly character.

Say: O loved ones of God! Time and again ye have been the target of affliction’s arrows in the path of the Lord of Names. Which prison hath not witnessed your presence, and which oppression hath not befallen you in the path of the Beloved? Ye have seen and borne countless trials. Preserve this most exalted station and most glorious rank. By My life! Were people to know, they would cast aside all deeds and circle round about you. But today they perceive not, neither do they understand.

Though the friends of God, exalted be His glory, have witnessed the faces of the companions of the left and of error like unto demons, yet they have also beheld and continue to behold the radiant countenance of God’s infinite favors. While on one side they have heard the clamor of the deniers, on the other they have hearkened to the most sweet call of the Beloved of the worlds in their remembrance. This bounty shall never cease. By the life of the Beloved! The servant presenteth and declareth with manifest truthfulness: Praise be to God for this mighty favor!

Concerning the imprisonment of His Holiness Ismu’llah, upon him be the Glory of God the Most Glorious, and the friends of God, as well as the intercession of some and the giving of funds to one of the women - all these details were presented before His presence. His blessed and exalted Word: The means for matters pertaining to the Truth appear from Him. Verily He confirmeth and inspireth, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. Those souls who have arisen to render service, which is among the requirements of the love of God and His loved ones, and who have endeavored and have not been remiss in expending their wealth and possessions according to their capacity - their reward shall not be lost with God, nor shall it ever be. Verily He recompenseth the doers and aideth the generous ones.

In such instances, nothing should be given beforehand. One who accepts a matter should be assured through a guarantor or other means, and after the matter’s completion and fulfillment, the promise should be kept. Although the honored ones have labored, yet the affair of the prisoners rests with God, exalted be His glory. Once these sublime words were heard from the tongue of the Lord of Names - His utterance, exalted be His glory: “The government had attained some measure of assurance, but certain lying tongues have spoken that which has again caused suspicion.” Thus did He speak. May God, exalted be His glory, recompense the liars. All know that the causes of contention and strife, and whatsoever is abhorrent to minds and souls, have been removed; yet they still say that which brings harm to the servants of God. May the Desired One guide them and show them the straight path.

Concerning what you wrote about the sinking of certain lands - similar occurrences have repeatedly happened in other places, but surely a great abasement awaits the people of the world as recompense for their deeds. We beseech God to awaken mankind, that perchance they may return and the world find peace. God has ever been and will continue to be lying in wait for the oppressors, as you have witnessed and will yet witness: verily He is ever watchful.

That other letter from that beloved one was indeed a brilliant lamp for the darkness of the world. It gave light to the heart and clarity to vision, for it was adorned and embellished with the lights of the love of the Beloved of the worlds. I beseech the Exalted True One and implore Him by the traces He has caused to flow from the pens of His friends, to rid the world of existence from the oppression of oppressors and adorn it with the lights of justice. Verily our Lord, the All-Knowing, is the Mighty, the Powerful.

Regarding what you wrote about the arrival in the land of Alif and Ba, and likewise concerning the enthusiasm of the friends of God, it was presented before the Most Holy, Most Exalted Presence. His words, blessed and exalted be He: He is the Compassionate, the Generous.

O thou who art mentioned before the Wronged One! We have made mention of them and have revealed unto them that whereby the essence of the world hath been set ablaze. Erelong shall its light and radiance become manifest. Verily thy Lord is the Mighty, the Chosen One. We have sent unto every name inscribed in thy book that whereby the lights have shone forth. Ask thou God to give the world to drink from the Kawthar of His knowledge and to manifest through His sovereignty that whereby eyes shall be gladdened. The ocean of hatred hath surged, and the Most Glorious Beauty saileth upon the crimson ark, moving upon it with power and sovereignty. By God! Neither the might of the idolaters nor the clamor of those who have disbelieved in God, the Lord of Lords, can hinder Him. Blessed are the companions of Alif and Ba. We have seen them and heard their call and their mention, and We give them the glad-tidings of God’s favor and His mercy. We have mentioned all with such mention as the treasuries of nations cannot equal. God willing, they shall attain unto it and drink from the ocean of inner meanings, that their ardor may increase. In all matters they must act with wisdom. That soul hath observed how effective and rectifying wisdom is. The people of the world are seen as beasts, save those whom God willeth. Their sole preoccupation is the acquisition and consumption of carrion. The chains of these beasts are wisdom. By My life! Wisdom hath a lofty station. Blessed are they that attain thereunto. Soon shall these tyrannous, rebellious, and insolent beasts find themselves impotent and abased beneath the claws of divine destiny - great is His power! Give glad tidings to My loved ones on My behalf. We counsel them to be calm and dignified. They should trust in God and commit all affairs unto Him. He is verily the Almighty, the All-Compelling.

Furthermore, mention was made of Fath. The mention of the souls of that land hath repeatedly flowed from the Most Exalted Pen, and in this year especially, divine Tablets were revealed and sent to each of the friends. This servant beseecheth the True One to assist His loved ones in such wise that the opposition and objections of the idolaters and deniers shall not withhold them from everlasting life. He is powerful and mighty.

Concerning what thou didst write about Zarqan and the friends of God, it was submitted, and this is what the Kingdom of Utterance hath spoken: If possible, thou shouldst proceed to that land and tarry there awhile, that perchance precious gems of meanings and utterance may be brought forth from the mines of that land through the hands of wisdom, and that they who possess vision may attain thereunto. Every locality needeth one to make mention, especially places that are ready and good lands. The mention of God, exalted be His glory, increaseth those who make mention, who are aware and who know, and it awakeneth and maketh mindful those who are heedless and asleep.

In the name of the oppressed One of the horizons!

Today the lights of the Sun of Justice have been obscured by the smoke of rancor and hatred, and amidst the warbling of the birds of truth and inner meanings, the cawing of ravens has risen. Say: O friends! Today is the day of steadfastness, and today is the day when all that was hidden in hearts and minds shall be made manifest. The Sun of Truth has risen and is shining forth; the deeds of every soul shall be witnessed and the station of each one revealed. Blessed are they who have clung to the cord of God’s Cause and have detached themselves from the world and all who dwell therein. Now that thou hast attained unto My Tablet and the traces of My Pen, render thanks unto God for this supreme bounty. Say: Praise be unto Thee, O God of the worlds and Goal of them that have known Thee.

And this is what was revealed for Jinab-i-Ghulam-Husayn, upon him be the Glory of God:

He is the Compassionate, the All-Bountiful!

A mention from Our presence unto him who hath been awakened by the Call and hath turned toward the Supreme Horizon, that he may rejoice and be of them that are thankful. Thy mention was made in the presence of the Wronged One, and this perspicuous Tablet was revealed for thee. Verily He hath heard and answered, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. We counsel thee to be steadfast and to act in such wise as would gladden the hearts of them that are nigh unto God - they who traverse the lands to exalt the Word of God and who rescue all who are drowning and cast down. Soon shall all power and might pass away, and power and might shall remain with God, the Almighty, the All-Praised. Leave behind what the people possess; take what thou art bidden with the fingers of submission and contentment, and be of the thankful ones.

And this is what was revealed for Jinab-i-Haji Muhammad-Rida, upon him be the Glory of God […]

In His Name, Who shineth from the horizon of the Prison!

The Most Desired One – Who hath ever showered the rain of mercy upon creation, nurtured all through the radiant sun of His loving-kindness, and opened wide the gates of bounty and repose for all – hath been imprisoned in the most ruinous of cities. Would that matters had ended there! Rather, each day from the horizon of hatred some fresh tribulation appeareth and some new affliction becometh manifest. Yet through the grace of God, exalted be His glory, the tribulations of the world and the afflictions of the nations have not and shall never deter Him from His purpose. He counseleth His loved ones to manifest supreme steadfastness. These fleeting days are not worthy of mention, much less that their manifestations should preoccupy the people of knowledge and deprive them of everlasting bounty. Grasp with the fingers of hope the hem of thy Lord’s mercy, the Lord of Names, and say:

I beseech Thee not to deprive me of the mantle of Thy grace and the robe of Thy loving-kindness. Thou art He Who hath named Thyself by Thy name, the All-Bountiful, and by Thy name, the All-Merciful. There is none other God but Thee, the Almighty, the All-Praised.

Praise be to God that those mentioned have attained the grace of God, exalted be His glory. Jinab-i-Aqa Mirza Ahmad and Jinab-i-Aqa Mirza Abdullah, upon them be the glory of God, from among the people of Ba who have settled in Shahrud – numerous exalted Tablets have been revealed and sent from the heaven of grace specifically for them, both before and after. God willing, through their luminous utterances and penetrating words that land shall be illumined, and new and wondrous flowers shall spring forth and become manifest through the water of their mention. O My Beloved! Would that the people of the earth might understand, comprehend and know! Alas! Alas! They will not awaken until they find themselves beneath the earth. The people sleep; when they die, they wake.

As for the mention of Jinab-i-Haji Seyyed Asadullah, upon him be the glory of God – praise be to God that he hath attained to the mention of the Beloved of the worlds. And again, after being presented at the Most Holy and Most Exalted Court, these manifest verses were newly revealed from the heaven of loving-kindness. His word, exalted and mighty is He:

He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing!

Verily remembrance is healing for hearts, mercy for souls, water for every truthful thirsting one, and a fire that speaketh in the Tree of Love: “Verily there is none other God but I, the Caller, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.” He who circleth round Me and turneth to My horizon and ariseth to serve Me hath mentioned thee. We make mention of thee in such wise as no remembrance in the world can equal. Verily thy Lord is the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous. Let not the affairs of men grieve thee. Hold fast to the hem of thy Lord’s mercy, the Almighty. Verily the people have turned away from that which profiteth them in the worlds of God. Blessed is he who hath turned unto God, whom the hand of God’s grace, the Mighty, the All-Wise, hath delivered. Thus have We lit the lamp of utterance in the niche of knowledge. Blessed is he who hath witnessed and seen, and woe unto every heedless and remote one.

Likewise was revealed from the heaven of loving-kindness specifically for the son of him who attained and ascended. His word, mighty is His glory:

He is the Watchful, the Near One […]

O Ali! Blessed art thou and blessed is thy son who hath been honored with the mention of My Most Exalted Pen and hath heard My sweetest call when the Light was shining from the horizon of Zawra. Blessed be God, the Lord of this great bounty. He is among those who heard and hastened until he entered the pavilion of glory when the Temple of the Cause was established upon an exalted throne. Give thanks unto God for having enabled thee to associate with them who love Me and hold fast to the cord of My providence, and who have confined their affairs to My mention and praise. He is verily the one mentioned by My Most Exalted Pen in the Crimson Book. Thy Lord, the Wronged One, the Stranger, beareth witness to this. Blessed be thy mother and thy brother, and they who have attained unto this glorious and wondrous station. We counsel thee with that which beseemeth your relationship to this Cause, through which every oppressor hath lamented and every pure heart hath rejoiced. The glory be upon thee and upon them from the presence of One Who is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

As to what thou didst write concerning thy brother, upon him be the glory of God, praise be to God, he hath attained to His grace, and the word that was previously uttered from the tongue of Grandeur - that word hath been and will ever be a help. There is no doubt it was sent down from the presence of One Who is Self-Sufficient, the Generous. The mention of thy other brother, upon him be the glory of God, was also presented before the Most Holy Court. Perfect kindness was manifested and They said that the mention of him and certain other known ones would best be kept confidential, as We have commanded wisdom and all must observe it. Otherwise, verily He protecteth whom He willeth by His command. This servant conveyeth greetings and salutations to them and beseecheth God, exalted be His glory, that they may be assisted in that which is lasting and eternal.

Concerning what thou didst write about the debts, God willing, they shall be paid. Verily, bounty is in His hands. He ordaineth what He pleaseth for whom He pleaseth. He giveth and bestoweth, and He is the Bestower, the Generous.

The other letter from that beloved one, dated the ninth of the blessed Ramadan, opened the gate of joy and closed the doors of sorrow, for it was adorned with the mention of the Beloved of the worlds and the health of that beloved of heart and soul. However, it also brought endless grief as it announced the martyrdom of him at whose steadfastness the very essence of steadfastness trembled, and before whose trust in God the reality of trust bowed down, and who resigned his affairs unto God, the Lord of the seen and unseen, the Master of the last and the first. This blessed blood hath not been, nor will be, shed in vain. We beseech the Almighty that He may enable all to return. Verily, He is the Ever-Forgiving, the Merciful. Otherwise, the effect of that blessed blood shall become manifest and evident throughout all regions. This pure blood is effectual water for the irrigation of the divine Tree. I dare not say more than this in this regard. Knowledge is with God.

As to what thou didst write concerning Aqa Mirza Zaynu’l-Abidin and Aqa Mulla Muhammad, upon them be the glory of God, their mention was presented before the Most Holy and Most Exalted Court. This is what the Tongue of Grandeur uttered […]

O Zain, upon thee be My Baha! O thou prisoner in foreign lands and exile in distant regions! The Wronged One maketh mention of thee and saith: Having tasted the sweetness of the love of the Best-Beloved of the worlds, every moment of that exile prideth itself over a hundred thousand native lands. No pleasure in all the world hath equalled or shall equal this pleasure. Thy tribulations are manifest and evident, shining bright as the sun. Since these afflictions are in the path of the Friend, there is no harm. I swear by the sweetness of the utterance of the All-Merciful that great freedom followeth that imprisonment, and boundless glory succeedeth that abasement. The glory be upon thee and upon him who is named Muhammad, who was imprisoned, incarcerated and banished even as his Lord was imprisoned, incarcerated and banished. This mention sufficeth him, from which the fragrance of loving-kindness hath been wafted in such wise that its traces shall never be cut off from the world. The Command is in God’s hands, the Lord of the Throne on high and of the dust below.

From the ocean of divine utterance, the pearls of grace and kindness have appeared in such wise as to require no interpreter, translator, expositor or assessor. The whole world be a sacrifice unto His bounty and His loving-kindness.

As to what thou didst write concerning those two adorned with steadfastness and acceptance - namely, the cotton-carders, upon them be the glory of God - and likewise concerning the collection of funds for the strangers, this matter was presented at the Most Holy and Most Exalted Court. This is what was spoken by the tongue of our Beloved and your Beloved, and the Object of desire of all who are in the heavens and the earth. His blessed and exalted Word:

O thou who gazest upon the Face! They have borne many hardships in the path of God. The recompense of their deeds is an everlasting and abiding treasure with the Mighty, the Trustworthy. They have ever been and still are occupied with service to the Cause. Their reward is with God, the Forgiving, the Generous. We testify that they have attained unto righteous deeds and that which beseemeth the Days of God, the Lord of the worlds. We, from this station, pronounce Our glorification upon them and give them the glad-tidings of God’s grace and mercy, which have preceded all who are in the realm of earthly dominion and the Kingdom.

In truth, they have performed their labors for God’s sake, for whatsoever they obtain, they expend in the path of God, glorified be His majesty. In all that lay within their power regarding the honored lady, the mother of His Holiness the Sacred One, upon her be the Most Glorious Glory of God, they have shown no negligence. Until now several letters have been received from that noble lady, and in each one she hath made mention of them and of what they have accomplished in His path. The funds which that beloved one hath received were most timely and appropriate, and acceptable before the Throne. The servant beseecheth his Lord to assist them and confirm them in that whereunto they have attained in the Cause of God, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

As to the request of Mashhadi Muhammad-Rida, upon him be the Glory of God, for a Most Holy and Most Exalted Tablet for his wife, upon her be the Glory of God, this matter hath been granted and illumined with the lights of divine acceptance. A most mighty and wondrous Tablet hath been revealed and sent. Deliver it unto him that he may attain unto it and partake of its fragrance. He, verily, is the All-Bountiful, the Generous. This is what hath been sent down from the Kingdom of utterance of the All-Merciful for His handmaiden who hath been named Narjis. His mighty Word:

In the Name of the Forgiving, the Generous […]

O my handmaiden! The handmaidens of the world are heedless of this supreme bounty and mighty benevolence. Their eyes are deprived of beholding the light of His countenance, and their ears are barred from hearkening to His call. All were created for this glorious and wondrous Day, yet they remain veiled and unmindful of it. Praise be to the Desired One of the world, that thou art adorned with the pearls of love and the gems of knowledge of the Best-Beloved of the worlds. This Tablet is as a crown for heads - adorn thy head of acceptance therewith, and remain firm and steadfast in the love of the Lord of Names. All the pearls and precious stones of the world are as nothing and shall perish compared to the pearl of thy love. Shouldst thou ponder upon this bounty, thou wouldst, throughout thy life, ceaselessly utter “Praise be unto Thee, O God of the worlds!” The glory of God rest upon thee and upon the handmaidens who have believed in God, the One, the All-Informed.

And regarding what thou didst write about Aqa Mirza Husayn, son of the late and elevated Mulla Muhammad-Sadiq, upon him be the glory of God and His mercy, it was presented at the Most Holy and Most Exalted Court. This is what was revealed for him from the heaven of bounty. He, exalted and mighty be He, speaks thus:

He is the All-Remembering, the All-Knowing

O Husayn! Count as a treasure the days of God. One deed performed therein is more beloved in the sight of God than the deeds of centuries and ages. Every possessor of insight hath witnessed this, and every bearer of ears hath heard it, for the call of Truth hath been raised at all times, and the Most Exalted Horizon hath ever been manifest and resplendent. Blessed are they whom the doubts of the suspicious have not kept back. Hold thou fast unto the cord of thy Lord’s bounty and say: Praise be unto Thee for having remembered me and made me known to Thee and for having sent down unto me from the heaven of Thy Will that which delighteth the eyes. I beseech Thee not to deprive me of what is with Thee. Verily, Thou art the One Who hath power over whatsoever He willeth. There is none other God but Thee, the Mighty, the Wise. The glory of God rest upon thee and upon thy mother who hath called upon her Lord, the Mighty, the Generous.

He is the Compassionate, the Helper!

As to what you wrote regarding the Land of K, it was presented at the Most Holy and Most Exalted Presence. Praise be to God, all have attained to the grace and favors of the Truth, and those few souls who have drunk from the Kawthar of the utterance of the All-Merciful were each previously honored with a special Tablet. This evanescent servant beseeches the Truth, exalted be His glory, and hopes that He may assist all to achieve that which He loves and with which He is well-pleased. As commanded, whenever you turn toward that land, convey to the mother of the sanctuary, the kinsmen, and other friends the greetings from the Truth and gladden them with His favors. Likewise, they commanded: “Make mention of the friends in the Land of Q and M on behalf of the Wronged One. All are remembered in the Most Holy and Most Exalted Presence and have attained His favors. We make mention of Ghulam-Rida who was imprisoned in My path and upon whom befell what befell My own Self in the Land of Ta. And We make mention of the people of Jasib whom the affairs of creation did not prevent from turning toward the Truth. We send Our greetings upon them and offer them glad tidings of that which God, the Lord of the worlds, has ordained for them. And We make mention of Mahmud as We mentioned him before, and We beseech God to assist him in serving the Cause as He assisted him in turning toward it. Verily, He is the Forgiving, the Kind.”

This is the meaning of His exalted Word: “And for each there is a portion in the Book.” Every soul that has shown the slightest turning has attained to the Most Great Remembrance. Were all the pens in the world to attempt to befittingly describe the fruits and effects of the remembrance of the Truth, exalted be His glory, they would surely find themselves impotent and wanting.

And as to what you wrote regarding the Divine Tablets, yes, what your honor has done - praise be to God - that beloved one has been assisted in all manner of service. This is a mighty station, by the Lord of the Mighty Throne!

As to your mention of his honor Aqa Mirza Asadu’llah M N, upon him be the glory of God and His favors, it was presented at the Most Holy and Most Exalted Presence. This is what the Tongue of Grandeur spoke, blessed and exalted be His Word […]

Thou hast attained unto that which was recorded in the divine Books of the past and present. Thou didst turn thy face toward God and traverse cities and wildernesses until thou didst arrive at the great and blessed Valley, where thou didst hear the call of the Wronged One - the Wronged One Who arose alone to promote the Cause in such wise that oppression deterred Him not, nor did hosts and legions stay Him from His purpose. He arose with His transcendent power and, through the Most Exalted Pen, gave glad tidings to all on earth of the manifestation of the Hidden and Treasured Name, and proclaimed it. The Most Exalted Pen in this station is the Tongue of Truth, exalted be His glory. Should anyone reflect even briefly upon the evident power, despite the opposition of the peoples of the world - from kings and subjects, from rich and poor - he would be moved to proclaim with majesty, might and power: “Unto God!” Verily, the Wronged One beseeches God to grant thee success and draw thee nigh unto Him in all conditions, and to record for thee the reward of thy deeds in His straight and manifest path.

From every letter and from every word flow rivers of bounty. I beseech and supplicate the Truth that He may grant them success. Likewise, I especially convey greetings and glorification to them.

Mention was made of his honor Aqa Muhammad Kazim and his honor Aqa Muhammad Hannasab, upon them be 96 [Baha’u’llah]. The mention of both was honored to reach His hearing, and the Sun of loving-kindness was directed toward them. Blessed are they in that they purposed, visited, attained, and drank. And peace be upon him who follows guidance.

With regard to what was written concerning Jinab-i-Aqa Mirza Maqsud, upon him be the bestowals of God, he arrived in this land and for a time dwelt beneath the sheltering grace of God, exalted be His glory, blessed with His favors. We met with him repeatedly, and likewise he attained the presence numerous times and was honored with the blessing of meeting. He demonstrated love, affection and sincerity. After departing from this land, several of his letters reached this servant and replies were sent. He has been traveling and journeying to various regions. This servant beseeches God, exalted be His glory, to aid him and keep him steadfast in His remembrance, praise and service. This matter was also presented in the Most Holy Court, whereupon it was stated: “Our favor was manifestly bestowed upon him to such degree that We repeatedly summoned him to Our presence, conversed with him, and counseled him as befitted and was worthy of him.” However, as commanded, that beloved one must associate and converse with every soul in such a way that if any breach in friendship should occur, no evidence would remain, for it has been stated that most matters are contingent upon their means. While in the presence, he demonstrated the utmost love and sincerity, and he himself intended to spare no effort in serving the Cause to the extent of his ability. What else God, exalted be His glory, may ordain remains to be seen. The Most Great Branch - may my spirit, my being, and my essence be sacrificed for the dust of His footsteps - also told him that if he were to choose to serve the Letter N, it would be closer to wisdom, that he might perchance be confirmed in conveying the renowned Word. What is said here is in accordance with wisdom. For instance, they have forbidden mention of the names of steadfast and assured souls in various regions, as harm might result, just as occurred in the Land of Ta, where they mentioned all souls both within and without, causing fear and alarm. Would that they had spoken truthfully - rather, they spoke utter falsehoods, God forbid, attributing rebellion and corruption. God protect us and you from the evil of these who know not what they say, who are as chaff before the winds of self and passion. We beseech God to guide all and adorn them with the ornament of truthfulness, purity and justice. Regarding what you wrote about Jinab-i-Mulla Husayn, upon him be the glory of God, having guided several souls to the ocean of divine knowledge - this account, as well as mention of various souls, was presented before Him. This is what the All-Merciful revealed in response, exalted be His grandeur: He is the Helper, the Compassionate, the Generous.

O Husayn! The Wronged One remembers thee as He remembered thee before, and counsels thee with that whereby the Cause of God, the Supreme, the Self-Subsisting, may be exalted. Thou art the one who entered the luminous Spot and heard the rustling of the Divine Lote-Tree, and attained unto that which was recorded in the Books of God, the Lord of the Day of Resurrection. The Cause of God hath come, and that which was hidden from eyes hath been revealed, and those in the graves have been raised. Blessed is he who hath cast away idle fancies, holding fast to the cord of God that hath been stretched out. Blessed art thou for having praised thy Lord and mentioned to the servants that whereby hearts were attracted. We make mention of him who was named Ahmad who visited the House, and We give him glad tidings of the remembrance of God, the Mighty, the Loving. O Ahmad! Hold fast unto the Sure Handle. Thus doth the Lord of creation command thee from His prison fortress. And We make mention of him who was named Muhammad-Qabil-i-Hashim who visited a House built by the Friend of God through the power of the Glorious One, that he may rejoice and give thanks unto his Lord, the Possessor of existence. Hearken unto the call of the Wronged One - verily He remembers God during the nights and days, at sunrise and sunset. And We make mention of him who was named Muhammad-Qabil-i-Rida and give him glad tidings of God’s loving-kindness, the Lord of all names, and We counsel him to be steadfast in this exalted Cause. This is a Cause at whose appearance the world was shaken, save whom God willed, the Lord of what was and what shall be. Blessed is every steadfast one whom neither clamor frightened nor affairs deterred. O Mahmud! Give thanks unto God that the Wronged One remembereth thee in such wise that every possessor of scent perceiveth therefrom the fragrance of God’s loving-kindness, the Lord of the seen and unseen. We counsel thee and those who have believed in that which God hath revealed in His Book that hath been sent down. Cast behind your backs all that is with the people, turning with your hearts to the horizon of Light. Say: This is a Light which, when it shone forth from the horizon of Will, all other lights submitted to it. To this testifieth the God of the Kingdom. The glory shining from the heaven of My will be upon him who mentioned you, and upon you, and upon him who guided you to the path of God, the Mighty, the Witnessed.

“They have attained what they desired through His grace. Can anyone enumerate the bounties and loving-kindness of God? Nay, by His Name, the Supreme, the Self-Subsisting!”

This servant beseeches confirmation and assistance for each one, and likewise offers greetings and praise. God willing, may they arise to serve the Cause in such manner that their mention shall endure throughout the duration of names. Verily He is powerful over all things.

And concerning what you wrote about Haji Muhammad Hassan and Aqa Siyyid Hashim and Aqa Ali-Naqi, upon them be the glory of God, it was presented before His presence and a Most Holy, Most Exalted Tablet was revealed from the heaven of His Will for each one. God willing, may they drink from the ocean of His utterance and be illumined by its lights. This is what was revealed for the first one, His blessed and exalted Word:

In the Name of the One God […]

Every soul that hath in this Day turned towards the Most Exalted Horizon and attained the knowledge of the Lord of Names is recorded as one of the people of Baha in the Books, Scriptures and Tablets. The Truth hath been made manifest, and with a single Word He hath tested all who dwell on earth. Likewise through that Word the reckoning of creation hath been completed, the accepted ones have been gathered together, the Balance hath been appointed, the Path extended, the Cry raised, and the mountains seen to move. Blessed is the soul that hath witnessed these mighty signs and become assured of and acknowledged that which God hath revealed. Know thou the worth of this station and beseech God, exalted be His glory, to keep thee steadfast and to confirm thee in deeds that are praiseworthy. He is the Powerful, the Mighty.

This is what was revealed for Jinab-i-Aqa Siyyid Hashim:

In His Name, the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing!

This is the Day of deeds. Whosoever acteth in accordance with the divine ordinances is recorded before God as the most noble of all creation and inscribed in the Book. O friends! This is a Day the like of which hath not been, nor ever shall be conceived. Strive ye that there may appear from you that which befitteth the Day of God. The world is adorned with diverse colors. Its ornaments, embellishments and hues are, in the estimation of them that possess insight, like unto a mirage, and shall ere long return to nothingness. Beseech ye God that these fleeting things may not deprive you of His everlasting bounty, nor leave you bereft. Blessed art thou and thy father who hath attained unto that which was ordained. Strive thou to make up for that which hath been lost. Verily He is the True One, the Trustworthy. He commandeth His servants that which shall be a treasure for them in His mighty and impregnable Kingdom. The effulgent glory shining from the horizon of eternity be upon the people of Baha who have not broken God’s Covenant and His Testament, and who have acted according to that which they were bidden in His perspicuous Book. Praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

This is what was revealed for Jinab-i-’Ali-Qabl-i-Naqi:

He is the Guide to His straight Path […]

The time of words hath passed away, and the age of deeds hath dawned. Blessed is he who hath clung to pure deeds in the Cause of God, the Lord of all worlds. Blessed is the servant whom neither hopes nor riches have withheld from his ultimate destiny, who came forward when the Call was raised between earth and heaven, and answered his Ancient Lord. How many a wealthy one hath been hindered by his possessions, and how many a poor one hath attained the ocean of riches when it surged in My Name, the Generous, the Bountiful. How many a man of eloquence hath been prevented from praising Me through following his passions, and how many a stammerer hath gained My beauteous praise. How many a sun hath been darkened at the dawning of the lights of the morn of My Revelation, and how many a star hath fallen at the rising of the luminous Day Star of My Name, the Shining. Where are the eyes and ears that have been prevented by their occupations from beholding the Most Exalted Horizon and from hearkening to this Most Sweet Call on a Day wherein the lights of the Countenance have illumined after the passing away of all things, and wherein earthquakes have seized all, both small and great. Thus have the spheres of utterance revolved through the name of thy Lord, the Merciful. When thou hast succeeded and witnessed, say: “Praise be unto Thee, O Lord of the world, and glory be unto Thee, O Thou Who art wronged by the nations, and splendor be unto Thee, O Splendor of those who are in the heavens and on earth.”

God willing, may they attain through His boundless favors - He Who is the Sovereign of existence and the Possessor of the seen and unseen - and act in accordance with what hath been enjoined upon them in the Book. The smoke of idle fancies hath prevented the world from recognizing the Best-Beloved of all creation. We must all, with hands of longing, cling to the hem of His grace, that perchance through the breezes of mercy and the rains of bounty, the dead in the valley of heedlessness and desire may obtain life and attain unto life everlasting.

[…]

O servant! Thou art favored by the grace of God and art mentioned in His presence. Mention by the Supreme Pen is among the great, pure, enduring, and special divine bounties for the servants. Whosoever attaineth unto it hath attained unto all good. However, the measure of success and prosperity hath ever been deeds performed in accordance with the commandments of God. Blessed are they who have attained thereunto. This is the Day wherein whatsoever is hidden shall be made manifest and every concealed thing shall become evident. This is the Day wherein secrets shall be brought to light, and this is the Day wherein all shall rise up. Praise be to God that thou hast attained unto the recognition of God, exalted be His glory, and hast drunk from the cup of His love at a time when all the world was deprived save for a few souls. Beseech God to assist thee in preserving that which hath been bestowed upon thee. Ibrahim hath repeatedly made mention of thee. We, from this station, send Our greetings upon thee and upon them that are with thee, and upon every believing man and believing woman who hath believed in God, the Lord of earth and heaven, the Desired One of all beings, and the Sovereign of the hereafter and of the former world. End. Praise be to God, thy brother is occupied in service and thou too hast attained unto recognition, and this servant, clinging to the hem of grace and bounty, beseecheth the Lord of Names to preserve this servant and thee and thy brother beneath the shade of the Tree of divine providence from the heat of self and passion, and to assist you in that which beseemeth His days. Verily, He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He desireth, and He is the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

And regarding the mention of nine names at the end of thy letter - Jinab-i-Aqa Abdul-Husayn and Aqa Ja’far and Aqa Mahdi and Muhammad-’Ali and Aqa Mahdi and Aqa ’Ali and Jinab-i-Aqa Muhammad Hashim, Aqa Sha’ban-’Ali and Aqa Mirza Muhammad, upon them be 96 (Baha’u’llah) - these were presented in the Most Holy, Most Exalted Presence. This is what was revealed for them from the heaven of the grace of our Lord and your Lord, and our Goal and your Goal, and the Goal of all who are in the heavens and the earth. His word, exalted be His grandeur:

In My Name, the Wronged One, the Stranger […]

O Party of God! Ye are the oppressed ones of the world. The enemies of this blessed party lie in ambush, and the oppressors watch from their outposts. From every direction fly the arrows of rancor, and the swords of hatred are unsheathed. They have had and have no helper save God. They have attained unto the light of His countenance and have scattered the pearls of life at His feet. Some gave up their lives, others their possessions, and some expended all they had. How many days and nights they found no rest from their sorrows. Yet all that hath befallen the party of God, exalted be His glory, is recorded and inscribed by His Most Exalted Pen. Soon shall they who have committed iniquity, infamy, rancor and hatred become aware of their own loss and the triumph of the Party of God, and shall witness it. O friends! Be not sorrowful, nor be ye shaken by the deeds of the oppressors. Praise be to God, ye have attained unto that which the divines of the earth, its rulers and learned ones are debarred from, though they were created for it. Blessed are ye, for ye have attained unto the knowledge and recognition and praise and glorification of God, exalted be His glory. Now strive ye, that heedlessness may not follow this awareness, and ignorance may not overtake this knowledge. Verily, He hath remembered you and counseled you with that which shall profit you in all the worlds of His worlds. He, verily, is the Sincere Counselor, the Compassionate, the All-Bountiful, the Forgiving, the Generous.

The bounty of God is more manifest than this servant can mention. The rays of the Sun of His generosity have encompassed the world of being. This is a station wherein the feet of the mystics and the accomplished are seen to falter, unless divine protection confirmeth and keepeth them firm and steadfast. The preservation of this station, too, dependeth upon His grace and bounty. Without His grace, we are non-existent, null, and unmentioned. There is no God but He, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting.

The other letter from that beloved one, dated the 13th of the blessed Ramadan, illumined the heart like light and perfumed the mind with the fragrance of wild roses. Praise be to God, the heavenly food of love descendeth continuously from the heaven of affection like the spring rains of mercy. May the true Sovereign bestow the reward of this friendship, love, attachment, kindness and unity. Concerning what you wrote about assisting the friends of God, news hath arrived from the land of Sh. and Abadih and other places. We beseech God, exalted be His glory, to aid the friends in rendering important services.

Regarding what you wrote about the mount of Ustad Mihdi, upon him be the Glory of God, and the small amounts, it was submitted. He said that what was done is acceptable, for had it not been done, it surely would have caused sorrow. And this is what was revealed for him from the Most Exalted Pen, His blessed and exalted Word:

In My Name, the Compassionate, the Generous […]

O Mahdi! The diverse peoples of the world and the scattered parties among the nations were all created for the recognition of God, exalted be His glory, and for the remembrance, praise and service of His Cause. When the call was raised and the Most Exalted Horizon was illumined with the lights of His manifestation, all were found heedless and turned away. Nay more, they pronounced sentence of death upon the pure blood of the Dawning-Place of God’s verses. Fie upon them and upon those who went astray and led others astray! I beseech God to assist thee under all conditions to serve His Cause. Thou art remembered in the presence of the Wronged One, and these manifest verses have appeared from the horizon of the heaven of bounty especially for thee. Know thou their worth and preserve them as thou wouldst thy life. Every soul who today hath attained unto the mention of God, exalted be His glory, is accounted and mentioned among the people of Baha. The glory shining from the horizon of the heaven of My bounty be upon those who have hearkened to My call, turned to My horizon, and arisen to serve My Cause, and upon thee and upon everyone who hath remained steadfast and whom the hosts of the Pharaohs have not frightened - they who slay Husayn and then weep for him at eventide and at dawn.

Concerning your mention of the exalted leaf, the mother of Aqa Mirza Inayatu’llah, upon them both be the Glory of God, their remembrance was presented at the Most Holy Court, and this is what the Tongue of Grandeur spoke, exalted be His grandeur: “We have mentioned her in various Tablets and have revealed for her that through which every person of insight discovers the immortality in the paradise of their Lord, the All-Forgiving. We send Our greetings upon her from the prison, and upon the members of the household who have endured in the path of God that which caused all atoms to lament, and every possessor of an illumined heart.” We give them all the glad-tidings of His special favors and command them to that which befits the Days of God, and We counsel them to patience. The station of patience is most exalted. In the Qur’an He says, blessed and exalted be He: “O ye who believe! Seek help with patient perseverance and prayer, for God is with those who patiently persevere.” He mentioned patience before prayer, even though prayer is a pillar of the divine tabernacle of glory. The Glory shining from the horizon of the heaven of My mercy be upon you, upon your elder and your younger ones, your first and your last, and upon those who love you, by the command of God, the Lord of the worlds.

The favor of God, exalted be His glory, towards them is more evident than the sun at its zenith and than fire upon the heights. He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He pleaseth. No one can say why or wherefore, for He is the Mighty, the All-Choosing. This evanescent servant conveys greetings and salutations to the family members and the leaf, upon them be the Glory of God. May they all attain, God willing, to that which God loves. If there is sometimes delay in responding, this is due to the volume of correspondence. I beseech God for success for myself and all. He is powerful and mighty over all things.

I presented at the Most Holy Court that which was befitting regarding the newborn. The favor of God concerning them is manifest and evident. Blessed is the newborn who has attained to the mention of God, the Most Great, and blessed is the father whose service the Supreme Pen has testified to, and blessed is the mother who has attained His beautiful mention. O Amin! While you drink milk from your mother’s breast, the world of the seen and unseen makes mention of you. You were born in His days and have attained His favors. The pens of the world are incapable of properly describing this station. Blessed art thou and thy father and mother, from God, the Possessor of the Kingdom of the hereafter and the former times, the Lord of the Throne and the exalted Seat.

Praise be to God! This child has traversed in one night the path of a hundred years, nay rather, has attained to God’s favor and mention in days when faces, scholars, nobles, and mystics were all deprived, save whom God willed. This is a great bounty and a tremendous favor. We beseech God, exalted be His glory, that they may ever dwell beneath the shade of the Divine Tree and drink from the Kawthar of meanings and utterance.

O thou who gazest upon His countenance and standest firm in service to His Cause! Convey My greetings to all members of the family, both male and female, from the Wronged One, and give them the glad-tidings of God’s all-embracing mercy, exalted be His glory. The Leaf is present before His countenance. Each of the leaves hath made mention of God. God willing, that leaf shall be the cause of universal triumph. Well is it with them, and blessed are they! We have made mention of all in various Tablets through verses that have enraptured the Concourse on High and the denizens of Paradise. We beseech God to aid them all, both men and women, in that which He loveth and is pleased with. In all matters let them act with justice. Poverty and wealth have ever been in the grasp of divine power. Ere long shall all good things return to that household, and the tongues of the world shall be loosed in its praise.

And as to their intention to pay the Huquq, excellent is what they have intended thereby. Their station shall be exalted and blessings shall descend upon them. Verily their Lord, the All-Merciful, is the All-Bountiful, the Generous. They are adorned and illumined with the lights of the Sun of grace and favor. A door hath been opened unto them which all the powers and forces of the world are powerless to shut. This is from God’s grace, which He bestoweth upon whomsoever He willeth. Verily, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

It is submitted that one year or more before the martyrdom of the King of Martyrs, he sent a letter to His Holiness Ismu’llah (upon him be all the most glorious Glory), wherein he beseeched that this servant had a property belonging exclusively to himself, in which no one else had any share, and requested that out of kindness and generosity they accept that it be sold and its proceeds be sent. And His Holiness Ismu’llah submitted this before the Presence. They accepted it, but concerning its sale a prohibition was issued. His blessed and exalted Word: “We have accepted it, but let it remain in their possession. They are trustees on behalf of God, let them dispose of it.” The intention was that some arrangement be made regarding that property and a specific use be determined for it. Now let that beloved one consider - whatever the heirs wish shall be done. This matter is mentioned because, since it was accepted, they should determine its disposition and in all circumstances take into account the satisfaction of the heirs.

As to what they wrote regarding the sum of two being for the Huquq and the property, what should be done - it was submitted and They said to act in whatever way they deem advisable, and these general matters are, according to the Command, dependent upon and subject to consultation.

Concerning what they wrote about Aqa Bigum who attained, the servant testifies that she was and is mentioned before the denizens of the pavilions of chastity and virtue and the tents of grandeur. And whatsoever that beloved one wrote was submitted before the Presence and achieved the honor of being heard. This is what the Tongue of Grandeur spoke, His word, exalted and mighty be He: “We have made mention of her and given her to drink of the choice wine of attainment, and We have counseled her with that which beseemeth the days of God, the Lord of the Mighty Throne. And We send Our greetings upon her and counsel her once again with that wherewith We counseled her before. She must hold fast unto the handle of the Cause and give thanks unto her Lord, the Generous.”

Concerning what was written about the epistle of the kindred of His Holiness the King of Martyrs’ sacred household, and likewise their successive tribulations and afflictions, and the degrees of their yearning and longing, their humility and supplication, and their cries and lamentations, and their hopes and aspirations - all of which have adorned the Holy Books, Psalms and Tablets - these matters were presented during two and a half hours on Monday night when the Ancient Beauty was alone and established upon the Throne. This is what the Tongue of Revelation spoke in reply:

God bears witness that not for a single day have they been absent from His sight. In all conditions, the glance of His favor has been directed towards them. None but God can enumerate their sighs in divine love. The Teacher of the realm of love and affection could fill numerous volumes with their tears of separation. The extent of their yearning and longing is evident and clear, but since the prison land is inwardly disturbed, permission for their presence was not granted. You know how many souls from all directions, with countless lamentations, humility and supplications, have begged for and continue to beseech permission to attain His presence. Nevertheless, only a few have been blessed with the effulgent rays of the Sun of Permission. Despite this, the heedless have said what they have said. Oppression has taken the place of justice, ignorance the seat of knowledge, and tyranny the station of equity. They speak without understanding, and verily they are among the most lost.

This year, trusting in God and detached from all else, let them intend to come. If the way is open and the paths are clear of satans, they shall attain their goal. Otherwise, they must turn with complete resignation and contentment toward the House and attain to pilgrimage. Verily, He accepts the deeds of the doers and does not suffer the reward of the righteous to be lost.

All the members of the pavilion of chastity and virtue have repeatedly beseeched His presence regarding this matter, but due to the opposition of the opposers, the burning fire of the fanatics, the prevention of the preventers, and the oppression of the oppressors, permission was not granted. Now He has said: Let them proceed, trusting in God and content with His command and will, toward the ultimate goal, but they must act with perfect wisdom and hold fast to prudence. Repeatedly from the Tongue of Grandeur this most exalted word was heard: He says the Manifestation of Truth is for the revelation of the Most Great Bounty and the Greatest Joy, that all might attain His presence and drink from the Kawthar of reunion, but enemies and the bearers of hatred have become like clouds between the Sun of Truth and His loved ones.

And likewise in one instance He uttered this most exalted word: Just as the loved ones of God, exalted be His glory, seek His presence and meeting, God too seeks to meet them. Verily He loves those who love Him, and they love Him. This evanescent servant beseeches and hopes from God, exalted be His glory, that He may cause those honored ladies to attain that which is recorded and inscribed in the Book of God. He is the Bestower, the Powerful. After hearing these exalted words from the Source of Command, such joy was experienced that none greater could be imagined, for the leaves of the Blessed Tree have never ceased […]

After these exalted words were heard from the Source of the Cause, such joy was experienced that none greater can be conceived. For always have the leaves of the Blessed Tree and this evanescent servant hoped and yearned for permission for this station from the Ocean of the Pre-existent Lord’s generosity. His is the praise and bounty, His the gratitude and favor.

Another letter from that Beloved One arrived which was a radiant and brilliant light dispelling the darkness of separation, and a luminous joy for the world of sorrow. It was like a spiritual messenger bringing glad tidings of reunion to the body. Well is it with your honor. And that mention was made of the beloved of the heart, his honor Varqa, upon him be the glory of God, opened wide the gates of gladness and delight. The armies of joy arrived and the hosts of sorrows fled like frightened zebras. Praise and gratitude be to God that the oppression of the oppressors, the hatred of the corrupt divines, and the swords of the deniers had no effect. After his capture, a word was revealed from the Supreme Pen to his honor Afnan, his honor A.H., upon him be all the most glorious glory, indicating his protection. A hundred thousand thanks to the Goal of the worlds that He granted the glad tidings of his release, bestowing upon the ear a wondrous delight from hearing it and upon the heart boundless joy from its truth. He is the Kind One and He is the Ultimate Hope of the friends.

And regarding what was written about the arrival of the leaves, three leaves were sent - may they be bestowed upon their owners. Blessed are they for having fulfilled God’s Covenant and His pledge, and for having acted according to what He revealed in the Book. And regarding what was written that these funds should be sent to whomever is designated, let them be used as commanded and let some debts be paid. In this regard, this supreme blessed word was uttered from the tongue of the Lord of Names: “Excellent is what they have done in the love of God and His path. Their deeds have been accepted and blessed is he who has not forgotten the one named Ja’far.” The funds that reached him, that is his honor Ustad Ja’far the mason, upon him be Baha’u’llah’s glory, were most acceptable before the Throne. We beseech God to assist all to do what is right.

This evanescent servant submits that that beloved one should be very careful in recording names and certain matters. In one letter Jinab-i-Isma’il Khan was written, and in another letter Aqa Isma’il ’Ali Khan was written. There have been other discrepancies as well. Although the reason is known and clear - that your honor’s complete attention at the time of writing has been and is directed toward that which is sanctified above all directions - nevertheless, since this servant must write what is true, especially regarding names and other matters, lest differences arise in what is said among the servants, therefore he requests that great care be taken in such matters when writing.

He sent forth His Messengers and revealed His Books that all might attain unto the straight path and be made ready to recognize the momentous News on the Day of Resurrection. His is the praise and bounty, His the grace and bestowal. He created and showed the way that all might attain to that which was the purpose of creation. He is God, exalted be His glory, the Most Great, the All-Powerful

=== START BH04709 ===

He is God, the Most Glorious of the Most Glorious

In these days when in the heavens of manifestation the spiritual suns have risen from the horizons of visibility, and the effulgences of the Sun of the Most Glorious Countenance shine forth from the dawning-places of existence, and the dawnings of divine knowledge gleam from the eastern horizons of the Kingdom, the moons of wisdom, in accordance with their illumination from the Ancient Sun, are giving light in every direction, and the stars of eternity are shining with perfect radiance from the heavenly spheres of existence. It would be a pity if one possessed of insight and knowledge should still be illumined by the light of a setting star of idle fancies and seek enlightenment from the moon of imagination which is in eclipse. Nay, the Sun hath shone forth from the pole of the heaven of the world with wondrous new effulgences of light. O friend! In these days the Ancient and Imperishable Beauty, the Unknowable Essence, Who was concealed behind a thousand thousand subtle veils of light, hath now appeared from behind the veil, and with but a single gleam from the effulgences of His countenance hath caused those who stood at Mount Sinai to swoon away and become as though they had never existed. Say: Verily, I have turned my face toward Him Who hath created the supreme heavens and hath rent asunder the lands of the Pharaohs, and I am not of those who join partners with God. Oh, oh! The Sun of Beauty hath made the world of hearts more radiant than the luminous day, and hath wiped clean from the tablets of hearts the rust of rational knowledge’s manifestations. And God guideth whom He willeth unto the straight path. And the Spirit be upon thee.

=== START BH04710 ===

In the Name of the Beloved of the Worlds!

In these days when the clamor of the polytheists has risen from most directions and the idolatrous souls are, with the utmost diligence and effort, engaged in extinguishing the light of divine unity, the Most Exalted Pen calls out with the most loud voice and bestows upon the friends their portion and share from the chalices of remembrance and utterance. God willing, may all attain unto that which God has intended, and he who attains shall not be frightened by the might of those on earth, nor shall he be made to stumble by the deceptions of the deceitful ones and the schemes of the transgressors. That honored one must in all circumstances be mindful of wisdom. The sword of utterance has been and ever will be sharper than the sword of steel, and the fruit of reformation more delectable and pleasing than the fruits of the world. Therefore must the sincere ones occupy themselves with planting the trees of reformation. If the root of this tree becomes firmly established through the grace of the Lord of creation, the roots of corruption shall be lifted from the world. You must, to the extent possible, remind the loved ones of God so that all may act according to that which they have been commanded, and all may become mines of love and affection and dawning-places of fellowship and unity. We beseech God, exalted be He, to make you one who remembers Him with His remembrance and who speaks forth His praise in such wise that hearts are attracted thereby and servants arise from the slumber of passion and turn toward God, the Lord of Names. Convey to all the friends in that land the greetings of this Wronged One and set them ablaze with the fire of divine remembrance. The glory be upon you and upon those with you.

The Servant
